Header: UN will give its fullest support to eliminate terrorism
Content: Representative for the United Nations Alliance of Civilizations Miguel Moratinos, has said that the UN will give its fullest support to eliminate terrorism and extremist violence in Sri Lanka. He said this during his tour in Sri Lanka recently. It was the first time that a high ranking UN Official toured Sri Lanka after the Easter Sunday terrorist attacks. He told President Maithripala Sirisena that the UN will always remain with Sri Lanka. The President expressed his gratitude for the support given by the UN. Mr. Moratinos told President that the UN was prepared to support Sri Lanka to establish social integrity and unity. He also met Prime Minister Ranil Wickremasinghe. He commended the exemplarily conduct of the religious leaders. Mr. Moratinos met the opposition leader Mahinda Rajapaksa, civil society representative, religious representatives during his tour.
